body.name: FLEXIMOUNTS 4x8 Overhead Garage Storage Rack, Adjustable Garage Storage Organization Systerm, Heavy Duty Metal Garage Ceiling Storage Racks, 600lbs Weight Capacity, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 20 hrs 50 mins
features: Avoid water damage by storing your items off the garage floor. Protect your items and use garage ceiling space to store seasonal and unused items. 22"to 40"ceiling dropdown provides up to 105 cu.ft of storage. Dimensions: 96 in. L x 48 in. W x 22-40 in. H. (Hooks sold separately)
STRONG AND SECURE: Buy overhead storage racks with long ceiling brackets designed to be attached to 2 studs. Combined with 6 vertical posts, it is the optimal structure choice to ensure safety.
HIGH QUALITY: Thicker M8 screws selected and all hardwares have gone through strict tests. Heavy duty cold-rolled steel construction provides safely loading up to 600 lbs.
INTEGRATED GRID DESIGN: More stable and sturdy compared to others with separate frame and wire.
DIY INSTALLATION: Installation template helps make plan. This overhead storage rack fits all ceiling joist spacing≤24", if joist spacing>24", only fits the ceiling spacing of 48".

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The FLEXIMOUNTS Garage Overhead Storage Rack is an ideal choice to maximize your storage space, and your garage will seem less cluttered and look more spacious. If We store things on the floor, they will become harder to find. Unless your garage is a climate-controlled room, things can get wet, dirty, or more easily come into contact with insects and rodents. Also it avoids flood damage to store your things overhead. This system is simple to set up and all the hardware and instructions needed are included in the package. A variety of size options available to purchase from FLEXIMOUNTS: 4'x8', 4'x6', 3'x6', 3'x8', 2'x8'.
Strict load test up 600lbs Top quality hardware provided,thicker M8 screws Hight adjustable from 22 to 40 inches,provides up to 105 cu.ft

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wish I would've bought this sooner...
reviews.reviewText: Adds a ton of storage for items that you don't need to access frequently. Very solid high-quality material. Install takes some time, but the instructions were spot on. Hardest part was lining up the ceiling brackets after finding the studs (with a stud finder) - all while on a ladder.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and fairly easy to assemble
reviews.reviewText: This is a great overhead rack. It was easy to assemble and you can configure it two different ways so it will work with your beams. The 96" is great for a lot of stuff and it is forgiving in that if your brackets are not perfectly straight due to the beams, the hanging arms will compensate. It took us about two hours to install.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well designed, well manufactured
reviews.reviewText: This is a well designed and well manufactured product. Particularly impressive is how well the bolt holes and threaded holes line up (it is all too common in many products that holes are misaligned, which requires you to enlarge them by drilling or filing - none of that with this shelving.) Having a ratchet wrench with a 13 mm socket made it a lot easier to attach the mounting brackets to the ceiling. Also, having a second person makes the job go 2-3 times faster. The instructions are reasonably clear overall; as others have noted, the layout and positioning of support brackets on the ceiling is the most time-consuming. After that, the installation proceeded smoothly. One minor glitch for 22 inch high shelving: I found a slight interference between the 2 pieces of the vertical support brackets. While they probably could be bolted together to function OK (or trimmed to fit), I used a 23 inch height, which worked perfectly. The shelving is very sturdy and has cleared a lot of "stuff" from our garage floor. I worried that the area might feel claustrophobic, but with the white finish and overhead clearance, that has not been a problem. We should have done this years ago!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Know your garage before you buy
reviews.reviewText: I just recently installed the 8' x 4' Fleximount storage rack. What I liked: (1) the product appears to be of good quality, nice looking black finish. (2) it’s packaged nicely, with all parts numbered and in separated plastic bags, (3) there is an ability to vary rack height to 40" maximum; (4) the storage is large and spacious. What I disliked: (1) no washers included for use between the mounting racks and lag screws (I ended up using my own); (2) somewhat vague instructions; (3) overall installation difficulty.The rack is mounted to the ceiling via six provided mounting brackets. You can mount these in parallel (three brackets each into two joists that are 48” apart) or perpendicularly (six brackets mounted across three pairs of joists that are 24” apart). I highly recommend you understand where your joists are in your garage before purchasing. It might be the orientation you want may not be possible given the orientation and spacing of your joists.Like most DIY projects, measurement is critical to success. Installation of the ceiling mounts is straightforward- finding the joists occupied more of my time than actually installing the brackets. My ceiling is textured and painted so it wasn’t obvious. In my case, I installed perpendicularly. Installation of the vertical mounts was a snap- though you have to make sure all mounts are 48” apart. The absolute hardest thing to do was to get the floor of the rack installed. The manual suggests assembling the pieces into the 8’ x 4’ length, lifting it onto the support arms, and then tightening the screws. This was not possible for me as I was working alone. The fully assembled rack flooring is super heavy and awkward. Furthermore, the dangling vertical arms are not stable enough to hold the platform while you are moving a ladder around tightening screws. I think this would be hard even with two people (as the manual recommends). What I ended up doing was mounting the first 4’ x 4’ segment of the flooring into place. Once this was secure, I added the second 4’ x 4’ segment into place and secured it to the first with the provided screws. This was not easy either! Lifting the 4’ x 4’ flooring while on a ladder was definitely precarious. I had to utilize bungee cords to attach to the vertical arms and the flooring to hold the platform in place while I moved the ladder around tightening all the screws.There is a little bit of wobble in the platform but not necessarily anything that worries me. Overall, I am happy with the way it looks and the storage volume is definitely spacious. One last note. A lot of people prefer to install storage in the area just above where the garage door rolls up. Keep in mind this may limit your storage volume. I decided against this because I only had something like 15 inches to the ceiling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install, exact fit
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased two FLEXIMOUNTS 4x8 Overhead Garage Storage Rack, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in terms of quality and functionality. The package arrived promptly and included all the necessary parts for installation, which was a huge relief.As an amateur, I was initially concerned about the installation process. However, I was pleasantly surprised at how straightforward it was. With clear and concise instructions provided, it took me about 4 hours to set up the entire system. The instructions were easy to follow, making the assembly a hassle-free experience even for someone like me who doesn't have much DIY expertise.One of the standout features of this storage rack is the material quality. The rack is sturdy and well-built, ensuring durability and reliability. I felt confident storing my belongings on it without worrying about the rack's stability. The adjustable design allowed me to customize the rack according to my garage height, providing ample space to organize various items in my garage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price
reviews.reviewText: Easy assembly and fairly sturdy for the weight. Great for reorganizing spaces where ground storage is an issue

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for saving garage space!
reviews.reviewText: Installation was not necessarily easy, but that was likely due to the configuration of our joists. Took a couple hours with an assistant, but once up it works great! I am hoping it holds everything up there, but it tends to sway a little when adding items, and that makes me less than confident . But I went through and verified each bolt is correctly installed to a joist and all other fasteners are tight. It is installed correctly, but still has some sway and crackling sounds to it. Likely just some paranoia on my part, but so far so good. I may wedge a 2x4 under it to give extra support, but probably not necessary. Overall, I recommend this product as it has really helped clear space on the floor of our garage!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great and very sturdy!
reviews.reviewText: I installed 2 of these in our garage. They are extremely sturdy and look great. You can definitely maximize your storage and clear out room to actually park your cars in your garage! Will be purchasing more from this brand to increase storage in our garage.
This overhead storage was excellent price and it is exactly what we were looking for. It has 8 tires on it and 6 big storage boxes! Super sturdy!
Was easy to install and parts are fit together easily. Instructions where clear and to the point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for ceiling storage in garage

reviews.reviewText: The storage rack provides good amount of storage in a garage with limited area but high ceiling. The rack is well made and the parts are of good quality, but it doesn't look sturdy. I will not load it to maximum capacity of 600lb.The unit lack lateral bracing which makes it wobbly when adding or removing items from storage. This also makes it vulnerable if your are in an area prone to earthquakes.For installation I couldn't trust the stud finder to locate the studs as the insulation in the ceiling causes the stud finder get confused. The main anchors that are connected to the ceiling joists are large and they must be installed exactly on the centerline of the joists otherwise their load capacity could be compromised. I had to locate the exact location of joists by poking holes in the ceiling drywall with a small nail.I plan to add some bracing to the overall installation to make it less wobbly and hope that the manufacturer adds these bracing as standard items.
I should have bought this years ago. If you have space in your garage ceiling, get it and you will not regret your decision. It was easy to install
